content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
No new structures have been successfully built on the map. Multiple attempts to place a Lab at position (0.5, 2.5) did not succeed because no Lab was available in inventory and its required sub‐ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic circuits, and copper cables) were lacking. Although existing furnaces were retrieved for resource processing (an iron smelting furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0) and a copper furnace at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0)), none of these operations resulted in a new structure being constructed by the agent.

ERROR TIPS
• API Argument Misuse for get_entities:
  – Avoid passing unexpected keyword arguments (e.g. “radius”) or incorrect positional arguments. Use the correct function signature when retrieving entities.
  
• Lab Crafting and Placement Failures:
  – Confirm that the Lab exists in inventory before attempting placement.
  – Ensure all required sub-ingredients (iron-gear-wheels, electronic circuits, copper cables) are sufficiently available; bolster the production chain (via smelting or crafting) prior to initiating Lab crafting.
  
• NoneType Handling:
  – Validate that returned entity lists are not None before iterating over them. Using a fallback such as an empty list can prevent iteration errors.
  
• Resource Management:
  – Check resource levels in advance to ensure that the complete chain of required ingredients is met, preventing repeated crafting errors for high-cost items like the Lab.
